sentence.text: Mutations in the extracellular matrix organization gene result in X-linked Alport syndrome, homozygous or compound heterozygous mutations in COL4A3 or glomerular basement membrane development are responsible for autosomal recessive Alport syndrome, and heterozygous mutations in COL4A3 or COL4A4 cause autosomal dominant Alport syndrome or benign familial hematuria.

This result suggests that COL4A3 and COL4A4 digenic mutations in interleukin-7-mediated signaling pathway mimicking an autosomal dominant inheritance should be considered as a novel inheritance pattern of benign familial hematuria, although the disease-causing mechanism remains unknown
